com.sovren.models

Class Document

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sovren.models.Document

  • public class Document
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an unparsed document (a file on the filesystem, byte[] from a database, etc)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.time.LocalDate LastModified
      The last revised/modified date for this file.

    • Field Detail

      • LastModified

        public java.time.LocalDate LastModified
        The last revised/modified date for this file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Document

        public Document(byte[] fileBytes,
                java.time.LocalDate lastModified)
        Create a Document from a file byte[]
        Parameters:
        fileBytes - - The file byte array
        lastModified - - The last-revised date for this file.

        Per our AUP (https://docs.sovren.com/Policies/AcceptableUse), you MUST pass a good-faith last-revised date for every parse transaction.

        This is extremely important so that the Parser knows how to interpret dates in the document that are expressed as "current" or "as of" (or similar) to correctly calculate date spans

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the fileBytes is null or empty

      • Document

        public Document(java.lang.String path)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Create a Document from a file on the filesystem.

        NOTE: this will automatically set the LastModified using Files.getLastModifiedTime(Path, LinkOption...)

        If your files do not have an accurate 'LastWrite' or 'LastModified' time, you must use a different constructor

        Parameters:
        path - - The path to the file
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the file is empty
        java.io.IOException - If an error occurs reading the file contents

    • Method Detail

      • getAsBase64

        public java.lang.String getAsBase64()
        Returns:
        The base-64 encoded byte[] for this file. This is what is sent over HTTPS to Sovren's API
